title: [$500] Members list becomes stale

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Needs Reproduction
labels.description: Reproducible steps needed

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from this [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1759992568048489), we could see customers run into an odd situation on the workspace members list, where after inviting a user to the workspace, the list was not updated immediately, only after a couple of minutes, even though the invite flow was successful.

Additionally, the owner has been showing in the list twice, even though they are a member only once. 

We were unable to reproduce this issue, but we have observed it in live video and full story sessions, indicating that certain conditions may lead to it. 

Can you identify the reproduction steps and propose a solution for this issue?

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @thesahindia</details>

title: [$250] mWeb - Chat - Chat not autoscrolled to the bottom after moving expense to new report.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.30-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1267/folder/13176730/41237112/950565582 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1916@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb) **App Component:** Chat Report View ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the staging.new.expensify.com website. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create a manual expense. 4. Open the just created expense. 5. Tap on the report field and select "Create Report" 6. Tap on the arrow on the top left corner to return to chat. 7. Note that chat is not autoscrolled to the bottom, and new report is not completelly visible. ## Expected Result: After moving an expense to a new report and returning to chat, the user should be automatically redirected to the bottom of the chat, where the new report is now displayed. ## Actual Result: After moving an expense to a new report and returning to chat, user is not automatically redirected to the bottom of the chat, and the new report is not completelly visible if chat is not manually scrolled. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/abb7e422-5fa9-4e27-97d3-c0c6d592b5da [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
